result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason R. Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jason R. Brown is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jason R. Brown was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Jason R. Brown was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and court costs have been combined into a payment plan with 14CF146 which is to be paid as follows:  $100 is due on or before 12-1-15 and then $100 per month due by the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full.  Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.

fingerprint cards destroyed

Defendant appeared in person with counsel Rick Niemeier.  Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  State files an amended Information on 14CF130.  Joint recommendaiton for sentencing.  14CF146 - pleads no contest to count 2.  14CF130 - Defendant pleads NC to Count 3 as amended in the Information & 4.  Court reviewed charges and penalties with defendant.  Court reviews plea questionnaire with defendant; finds he freely, voluntarily, and intelligently enters his pleas and waives his rights.  Finding of guilty to the 3 counts with a no contest plea entered.  Sentencing recommendations - 14CF130, Cts 3 & 4 - $50 plus costs; 14CF146, Ct 2 - 15 days jail or probation with conditions with court costs.  Defendant speaks and does not wish to be placed on probation; requests jail term to be stayed until 12-7-15.  Court accepted the recommendation on 14CF130 - $50 plus costs on Counts 3 & 4 without DNA surcharge or drug surcharge; 14CF146 sentenced to 21 days jail stayed until 12-7-15 at 6:00 p.m.  If defendant has any new charges, law enforcement contact, or any contact with Robert Fitzpatrick prior to 12-07-15 the jail term is to commence immediately.  Court costs also assessed on 14CF146 without any DNA surcharge.  Court grants a payment plan of $100 per month to commence 12/1/15 with failure to pay on all counts being 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.  All other counts are dismissed.

Defendant Jason R. Brown in court with attorney John Bachman.  Gerald R. Fox appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probable cause found on both felony counts.  Arraigment set.  Bond continued.  All pending cases will track with this case.  Arraignment scheduled for December 1, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Defendant Jason R. Brown in court with attorney John Charles Bachman.  Melissa S. Inlow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond amended.

This bond covers 14CF146 & 14CF130:  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals: Robert F. and Karen W.  AMENDED 11-7-14:  No contact between defendant and Karen Wall is lifted.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals: Robert F. or Karen W.. Officer is ordered to accompany him to get his things from the home and leave.  AMENDED 11-7-14:  No contact between defendant and Karen Wall is lifted.
